metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10269 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: BWA (aka Burrow-Wheeler Aligner) before 2019-01-23 has a stack-based buffer overflow in the bns_restore function in bntseq.c via a long sequence name in a .alt file. It was discovered that Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) mishandled certain crafted .alt files. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: bwa package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.17-3').
